page.title: 11The Workhouse at Chobham
page.content: When{people}were too{poor}to pay the rent, they were sent to the{workhouse to live. They were made to work and sometimes{children}were sold. It was a great disgrace to be sent to the workhouse but apart from that{married {couples}were separated. Chobham's work house was at{Burrow Hill.}If any relatives claimed you, which was most unlikely, they could bail you out. The workhouse was so revolting that people put away money in their wills for their{servants}so they could be looked after. One workhouse was called Jubilee Cottages at Red Lion Road. It burnt down two years later. In 1790 it was rebuilt on waste land. In 1920 the first{council houses}were built. The workhouse was converted into three cottages.{Orphans}were handed over to people as servants until about the 1930's.
